title: Compositionally in Neural Networks
blurb: PhD student Michael Lepori discusses new approaches to studying compositionality in neural network models in a recent Carney Community Spotlight.

title: Finding the art in artificial intelligence
blurb: When design and neural networks mix the results are both practical and innovative.

title: Brown researchers teach computers to see optical illusions
blurb: By making a neural-network computer model that can be fooled by optical illusions like humans, the researchers advanced knowledge of the human visual system and may help improve artificial vision.

title: Research identifies key weakness in modern computer vision systems
blurb: In a finding that could point the way toward better computer vision systems, Brown University researchers show why computers are so bad at seeing when one thing is not like another.

title: Focus on early stage of illness may be key to treating ALS, study suggests
blurb: Many inhibitory neurons were lost early in the development of ALS, new research shows, which is in sharp contrast to other degenerative diseases.

title: University conference explores future of artificial intelligence
blurb: Interdisciplinary workshop brings together professors, students from diverse academic fields

title: Researchers gather at Brown to discuss next-generation artificial intelligence
blurb: Technology known as deep learning has fueled an AI revolution, but a workshop series kicking off at Brown this week will consider where the field might go from here. Article by Kevin Stacey.

title: A New Knock-In TDP-43 Mouse Enters the ALS Ring
blurb: An emerging mouse model may help scientists identify early changes that occur in ALS that could be targeted in the disease. Article by Richard Robinson.

title: Artificial intelligence helps scientists map behavior in the fruit fly brain
blurb: Can you imagine watching 20,000 videos, 16 minutes apiece, of fruit flies walking, grooming, and chasing mates? Fortunately, you don’t have to, because scientists have designed a computer program that can do it faster. Aided by artificial intelligence, researchers have made 100 billion annotations of behavior from 400,000 flies to create a collection of maps linking fly mannerisms to their corresponding brain regions. Article by Ryan Cross.

title: Meeting of the minds leads to brain science technology venture
blurb: Article by David Orenstein.

title: A computer with a great eye is about to transform botany
blurb: Article by Margaret Rhodes

title: Computer vision can help classify leaves
blurb: So complex are patterns and variations in the vein structures of leaves that botanists struggle to take advantage of them when trying to classify a specimen within the plant kingdom. A new study shows that computer vision technology can provide automated assistance by “learning” how to use venation to assign leaves to their proper family and order. Article by David Orenstein.

title: Linking two labs a learning opportunity for Ph.D. student
blurb: Aaron Held’s research merges and draws on the expertise of two of the labs in Brown’s broad effort to combat ALS. That role has given him several opportunities to learn novel skills and new science during graduate school. Article by David Orenstein.

title: In analyzing a scene, we make the easiest judgments first
blurb: Article by David Orenstein.

title: Reducing Myc gene activity extends healthy lifespan in mice
blurb: Mice with one rather than the normal two copies of the gene Myc (also found in humans) lived 15 percent longer and had considerably healthier lives than normal mice, according to a new Brown University-led study in Cell. Article by David Orenstein.
